intro: Jacquemontia blanchetii var. major, commonly known as the large-flowered Jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to parts of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes vines and climbing plants. The species is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with five lobes. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are slender and twining. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
